column4: I'm even trying to use vesa, with dpkg-reconfigure, but that too wont work. Could someone please help me?
All I get is a solid brown screen, after having logged in. This all started after installing ATI drivers from ati.com.
perhaps you could refresh our minds as to your problem
;) Any idea how to solve this?
uninstall the drivers?
How can I do that?
not sure,. probably in single user mode
Single user mode? :S
at grub selection, choose the second boot option not the first
Alright. When that has loaded, then what?
dunno,.,. just gettin you half way there,. your new question,. is ,.,. how can i uninstall the ati drivers from command line?
Heh. Righto.
do you no the name of the package?
There was no deb. I installed it off of ati.com.
what you compiled yourself?
No, a binary file I downloaded from there.
why not use the ones ubuntu provide in restricted drivers?
Because Google Earth wouldn't recognize the driver but said I should download drivers from ati.com instead.
i would trust the ubuntu guys over ati guys any day,.,.;~)
are you at the CLI?
Yes
see if theres an error log in your home folder
Nothing.
